    • Method Detail

      • addDay

        public boolean addDay​(Day d)
        If possible add a new Day to 'days'. A day cannot be added if all the days that occur before it are not already added. Example- You cannot add a Day with index 3 before having 3 days(0 to 2) in the ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        d - is the Day to be added.
        Returns:
        If Day is successfully added return true, else false.

      • deleteDay

        public boolean deleteDay​(Day d)
        If possible delete the Day given in the argument. A day cannot be obviously deleted if it does not exist.
        Parameters:
        d - is the Day to be deleted.
        Returns:
        If Day is successfully deleted return true, else false.

      • addEvent

        public boolean addEvent​(int dayIndex,
                        int startTime,
                        int endTime,
                        java.lang.String eventName)
        If possible add a new Event at its appropriate position. A event cannot be added on a Day that does not exist.
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - is the Day at which the event is to be added.
        startTime - is the start time of the event.
        endTime - is the end time of the event.
        eventName - is the name of the event to be added.
        Returns:
        If Event is successfully added return true, else false.

      • deleteEvent

        public boolean deleteEvent​(int dayIndex,
                           int eventIndex)
        If possible delete the Event from its respective day and index. A event cannot be deleted from a Day that does not exist.
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - is the Day from which the event is to be deleted.
        eventIndex - is the index of the event to be deleted.
        Returns:
        If Event is successfully deleted return true, else false.

      • modifyBST

        public void modifyBST​(int dayIndex,
                      int eventIndex,
                      int bst)
        Change the time of the event considering the BST introduced.
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - is the index of the required Day.
        eventIndex - is the index of the required Event.
        bst - is the amount of bst to be introduced.

      • cascadeBST

        public void cascadeBST​(int dayIndex,
                       int eventIndex,
                       int startBST,
                       int reduce,
                       int maxEvents)
        This method is used to simulate that adding BST to a event affects all the events after it. After every event the amount of BST introduced to the event reduces by the amount given in the parameter 'reduce'. It stops affecting events once the left BST <=0 or it has already affected events equal to 'maxEvents'. It also carries over to the next day if possible. startTime and endTime of a event have no role in determining if BST will be passed to it or not. Assume the sorted order of events is maintained in the Doubly Linked List after the execution of the function.
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - is the index of the required Day.
        eventIndex - is the index of the required Event from which it starts.
        startBST - is the amount of bst to be introduced to the first event.
        reduce - is the positive amount of bst to be decreased after affecting a event. Suppose startBST=5 and reduce=1. First events gets a BST=5, 2nd event=4, 3rd event=3 and so on.
        maxEvents - is the maximum number of events it can affect.

      • clash

        public int clash​(int dayIndex)
        Calculate the pair of events that clash on the given day. Assume only the adjacent events clash i.e. 2nd event can clash with 1st and 3rd but not with 4th.
        Parameters:
        dayIndex - is the index of the required Day.
        Returns:
        return the number of clashes on that particular day.
